name: Barcode
description: A label used for tracking or identification, typically scanned during assembly or maintenance.

name: Bell
description: A small audible device mounted on the handlebar used to alert pedestrians or other riders.

name: Bottom bracket
description: The bearing assembly that connects the crankset to the frame and allows it to rotate.

name: Brake cable/hose
description: The conduit—mechanical cable or hydraulic hose—that transmits force from the brake lever to the brake unit.

name: Brake lever
description: A hand-operated control mounted on the handlebar that actuates the brake system via cable or hydraulic pressure.

name: Brake pads
description: Friction material that presses against the rim or disc to slow the bike.

name: Brake unit/caliper
description: The braking mechanism that clamps onto the rim or brake disc, applying friction to slow down or stop the bike.

name: Bye bye battery
description: Likely a placeholder or label referring to the battery component or cover.

name: Cable
description: A generic term for wiring used throughout the bike for brakes, gears, or electronics.

name: Carrier
description: A rear-mounted platform used for carrying cargo or bags.

name: Carrier bracket
description: A mounting support used to attach the carrier to the frame.

name: Carrier bumper
description: A protective piece attached to the carrier to prevent damage to items or surfaces.

name: Cassette-joint
description: A component involved in torque transfer, especially in internal gear hubs.

name: Chain
description: A loop of linked metal segments that transfers pedaling force from the chain wheel to the rear sprocket, propelling the bike forward.

name: Chain lock
description: A lock made of metal links used to secure the bicycle.

name: Chain wheel
description: The front gear that the chain wraps around, attached to the crank.

name: Chainguard
description: A protective cover over the chain to prevent clothing from getting caught or dirty.

name: Crank
description: A lever that connects the pedals to the bottom bracket, converting pedaling force into rotational motion.

name: Fender
description: A curved cover that sits above the wheel to block water and debris.

name: Fender stay
description: A metal support that secures the fender to the bicycle frame.

name: Frame lock
description: A lock mounted to the frame that immobilizes the rear wheel.

name: Frame/panel
description: The main structural part of the bicycle, connecting all components together.

name: Front fork
description: The part of the frame that holds the front wheel and allows it to pivot for steering.

name: Gears
description: Mechanisms that change the speed-torque ratio transmitted to the wheels.

name: Grips
description: Rubber or foam sleeves on the handlebars for rider comfort and control.

name: Handlebar
description: The component used by the rider to steer and control the bicycle, typically equipped with grips and controls.

name: Headset
description: The bearing assembly that connects the front fork to the frame and allows steering.

name: Headset cover
description: A top cap that protects the headset assembly from dirt and moisture.

name: Hub
description: The central part of a wheel where the axle connects, allowing rotation.

name: Innertube
description: An inflatable tube inside the tire that holds air.

name: Kickstand
description: A folding support that lets the bike stand upright when not in use.

name: Kickstand foot
description: The end part of the kickstand that contacts the ground for stability.

name: Light
description: Front or rear lighting for visibility and safety.

name: Magnet
description: A small magnetic sensor component used in speed detection or other systems.

name: Pedals
description: Foot platforms attached to the cranks that the rider pushes to propel the bike.

name: Reflector
description: A passive safety device that reflects light to make the bike visible in low light.

name: Rimtape
description: A strip that protects the innertube from spoke holes in the rim.

name: Saddle
description: The bike's seat, designed for rider support and comfort during use.

name: Saddle clamp
description: The mechanism that attaches the saddle to the seatpost.

name: Seatpost
description: The tube that supports the saddle and adjusts for rider height.

name: Seatpost clamp
description: A clamp that secures the seatpost in place within the bike frame.

name: Shifter
description: A control lever on the handlebars used to change gears.

name: Shifter cable
description: The cable that connects the shifter to the derailleur or internal gear hub.

name: Spoke/nipple
description: Spokes connect the hub to the rim; nipples secure them and adjust tension.

name: Sprocket
description: A toothed wheel that engages with the chain, typically part of the rear drivetrain.

name: Stem
description: The component that connects the handlebars to the steerer tube of the fork.

name: Tire
description: The rubber outer layer mounted on the wheel that provides traction and absorbs road impact.

name: Valve
description: The mechanism through which air is added to or released from an innertube or tire.

name: Wheel
description: A complete rotating assembly including hub, spokes, and rim; supports the tire and allows movement.
